alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 11 at 1:06PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 415 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over Kauai with the heaviest storms near windward Kauai near Wailua and Kapa`a. Rain was falling at a rate of up to 2 inches per hour. Additional heavy rain is expected during the next several hours across the state. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lihue, Kapaa, Kalaheo, Kekaha, Princeville, Kilauea, North Fork Wailua Trails, Lawai, Omao, Kokee State Park, Wailua Homesteads, Hanalei, Hanapepe, Wainiha, Na Pali State Park, Koloa, Haena, and Wailua. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 415 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
